name: 02-Data-Preparation
content:
Data Description and Preparation

Data Description:

The dataset consists of Accounts Receivable / Payable and Collection transaction records with engineered features.

Key columns include:

  • Categorical Variables: HAS_30DAY_EXTXN, PAST_DUE_FLG, CURRENCY_CODE, COLLECTION_STATUS, LATE_PMT_GT_30.
  • Numerical Variables: TOTAL_AMOUNT, BALANCE_DUE, WRITEOFF_AMT, BILL_FREQ_NUM, TOTAL_NUMBER_OF_CASES, NUM_NONPMT_CASES, NUM_URGENT_CASES, AVG_AGE_PER_CASE.
  • Granularity: Customer-transaction level, aggregated by invoice cases.
  • Time Period: Historical AR/AP collection records (period defined in dataset).

Data Preparation Steps:

  1. Data Cleaning:
  • Handle missing values (e.g., fill nulls in categorical features).
  • Treat outliers in TOTAL_AMOUNT and BALANCE_DUE.
  1. Feature Engineering:
  • Flags for late payment (>30 days).
  • Case-type aggregations (NUM_NONPMT_CASES, NUM_URGENT_CASES).
  • Risk indicators (HAS_30DAY_EXTXN, PAST_DUE_FLG).
  • Customer-level derived ratios: BALANCE_DUE / TOTAL_AMOUNT, WRITEOFF_AMT / TOTAL_AMOUNT.
  1. Data Transformation:
  • One-hot encoding for categorical features (CURRENCY_CODE, COLLECTION_STATUS).
  • Normalization/scaling of continuous variables for model input.

Data Profiling and Analysis

Data Profiling:

  • Missing Value Analysis – Ensure completeness of categorical flags.
  • Distribution Checks – Verify skewness in TOTAL_AMOUNT, BALANCE_DUE.
  • Correlation Analysis – Between outstanding amounts, write-offs, and late payments.

Descriptive Analysis:

  • Industry Distribution of Customers – Sector-wise segmentation of payment behaviors.
  • Late Payment Trends – Distribution of LATE_PMT_GT_30 across industries.
  • Collection Status Insights – Counts of PAID, PENDING, DELAYED by customer segment.
  • Average Paydex Score by Industry – Benchmarking reliability.

Predictive Analysis:

  • Payment Distribution wrt Credit Check Decision – Linking creditworthiness with payment behavior.
  • Outstanding vs. Write-off Analysis – Quantifying financial risk exposure.
  • Customer Revenue vs. Outstanding – Identifying high-revenue but risky accounts.
  • Late Payment Forecasting – Using Random Forest to predict late (>30 days) vs. on-time payments.
